title: Narrow sans found in PDF-document
content:
Hello

Found this gorgeous font in a PDF document. Anyone recognize it? Thanks!

[http://kanelbulle.myftp.org/~emil/uploaded/Picture%2041.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410171832/http:/kanelbulle.myftp.org/~emil/uploaded/Picture%2041.png "http://kanelbulle.myftp.org/~emil/uploaded/Picture%2041.png")

 [‹ "Rip" grunge slab serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410171832/http:/typophile.com/node/44093 "Go to previous forum topic") [J and B logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410171832/http:/typophile.com/node/44090 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kanelbajsarn

comments.content:
Emil,

have you tried checking the PDF’s fonts information in Acrobat (Reader)? If the text hasn’t been converted to outlines (or bitmaps) before, then this will list all the featured font names.

F

It’s one of those CMSS (Computer Modern Sans Serif) fonts. CMSSDC10 probably.

[http://www.identifont.com/show?769](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410171832/http:/www.identifont.com/show?769 "http://www.identifont.com/show?769")

Thanks!  
CMSS is the correct answer. Confirmed by the PDF’s font information (which I didn’t know existed).
